Hi Rob,

It would be great if you just copy and past the order file, seeds and and per host settings (if any.)
If I don't see anything unsully in the configuration that prevents the crawl from crawling your 
seeds I will try to reproduce the problem on our side.
i.


> It was runnign for about 30 mins when I stopped it.  The progress
> statistics log never showed busy threads higher than 3.  According to
> the progress meter int he console it was only 50% of the way through
> the queue.
> How do you want me to send the order file?
> 
> Thanks,
> Rob.
> 
> 
> --- In archive-crawler@yahoogroups.com, Igor Ranitovic <igor@a...> wrote:
> 
>>Hi Rob,
>>
>>For how long have you been crawling these seeds? Is it possible that
> 
> the crawl is almost done and 
> 
>>only one host is left to be crawled. In progress-statistics.log do
> 
> you see that number of busy 
> 
>>threads was around 20 for some time at the beginning?
>>
>>Could you also send us the order file for us to take a look at it.
>>Thank you.
>>
>>Take care,
>>i.
>>
>>

>>>--- In archive-crawler@yahoogroups.com, "robeger" <reger@a...> wrote:
>>>
>>>
>>>>I've got a crawl running with 21 seed URIs, and the max toe threads is
>>>>set to 50.  I've never seen a higher number than "4 of 50" in the
>>>>active threads value on the console page.  Am I not understanding
>>>>something, or do I maybe have something set incorrectly?  I guess I
>>>>was expecting that  I'd see more active threads (21? since there were
>>>>21 hosts being crawled?)
>>>>
>>>>Thanks,
>>>>Rob.
